author: Amazon Customer

review: I excitedly received my Chromecast and got 3/4 through the setup, but am getting an error that Chromecast cannot connect to my network, and i have to either modify the AP Isolation or enable the UPnP.  The UPnP was easy enough to locate, and it is enabled - but i have no clue as to how to modify the AP Isolation in my router settings.  I've sent a note to the support department for my router (Netgear) - but i have NEVER had any problems getting other hardware to connect to my home WiFi network:  TiVo, Roku, Wii, PlayStation, multiple computers - all have connected seamlessly and i expected a smoother setup from Google.  Very disappointed so far.  I'll update this if i can ever get it installed.  2 Stars for now (I haven't abandoned hope yet).***Update: i had to manually enter the MAC address of the Chromecast into my router to get it connected.  Google's Support never mentions this, and if you're "googling" for Chromecast support, your results are biased towards GoogleSupport.  I had to page through several results to find a forum that mentioned hardcoding the MAC address.  No opinion on the product yet, but Google's support for the product has so far been inferior and inadequate.I actually got some media from my MacBook to "cast" to the television - YouTube video, Netflix... i had a webpage casting - but then the ChromeCast got "lost" and does not appear in my "casting" icon in my Chrome browser.  Still looks like i am having connectivity issues.

review: Had the apple cable that connects the ipad to the tv for about 4 years, but since im planning to buy the latest ipad, i decided to give this a try. It is amazing! The quality of the image is way better then the apple cable, and it puts youtube videos in great quality on to your tv! If you love netflix, hulu, youtube, and so on, def get it! I cancelled my cable 2 years ago and have only rhose services now, this gadget is great for this!

review: I use it ever single day. I used to hook my computer up to my TV but it was annoying having to drag windows and never remember where I last closed the program (Windows 7 thing). I love the amount of people getting involved, too (HBO GO, Hulu, Netflix, Pandora, etc.). It's so easy to use, a little buggy at times but getting updates all the time, and it frees up my computer for games and browsing only. Love it.
